discussion.content: TFTP and FTP or TFTP and HTTP?

questions.question_text: A customer is using the access point GUI to upgrade the software on an autonomous access point to convert it to a lightweight access point. Which two transfer protocols are valid for conducting this transfer from the WLC? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Here some notes to resolve,
 1. Required EIRP is 200 mw which is 1*10*10*2 or 0 dbm + 10 db + 10 db + 3 db. So 200 mW = 23 dbm

 

 2. Antenna gain is 21 dbi

 

 3. Since total EIRP is the product of conducted power plus antena gain and the latter is a given, then power fed to the antenna = 23 dbm minus 21 db = 2 dbm

 

 4. So in order to achieve a 23 dbm EIRP, we need to feed 2 dbm to the antenna.

 

 5. Now we need to compensate for the loss introduced by the cable which is 2 mW or 0 dbm + 3 db. so

 

 configured Tx power = 2 dbm + 3 db = 5 dbm

 

 6. From all of the above we arrive at the conclusion that in order to achieve a 23 dbm (200 mW) EIRP in the given scenario, we would need to configure the radio with a 5 dbm (3.16 mW) Tx power setting.

questions.question_text: An installation uses a 21dBi parabolic dish. It is connected to the 802.11n radio via low loss antenna coax rated at 4dB loss/100 feet. After testing, it has been determined that 2mW of power will be lost in the cable. An EIRP producing 200mW is desired. What should the transmit power be set to?
When using multiple SSIDs on a lightweight AP, how does the traffic of each SSID reach the 802.3 network?

choices.B: configure 802.11q trunking on the Ethernet switch port that is connected to the AP
choices.C: configure ACLs at the switch port that will allow all desired SSIDs to pass traffic
choices.A: provide routing between them at the core so that the SSIDs can reach the internet
choices.D: configure the SSIDs on the WLC and it will regulate the traffic based on traffic type

discussion.content:
Assumed that the lightweight AP is in FlexConnect mode, it needs to be connected via trunk to be able to do local switching in case of a WAN problem.
Agree, that B matches best.

D is not correct due to the regulates traffic.

B is the best answer

The correct answer is D. Lightweight access points are recommended to be connected to an access port by Cisco. The WLC builds a CAPWAP tunnel to the AP and all traffic is passed to the WLC over the CAPWAP tunnel. The WLC then controls the traffic.

After searching the internet it seems, I am alone with this opinion.
So: Go with A-C-H.
...and "microwave oven" is always a good answer regarding WiFi, independent what the question is...

I think it should be C - E - H.
Microwave ovens is important for passive, but not for active surveying, when the planned usage of the WiFi network is verified/tested.

questions.question_text: An engineer is gathering information for a wireless survey of a hospital. What three pieces of information must be collected for an active survey to assess the outcome best suited for the facility? (Choose three.)

choices.B: number of patients that are at the facility
choices.E: use of wireless for secure records
choices.H: type of devices present on the new wireless network
choices.G: existing Network Switch types and model numbers
choices.F: spectrum analysis to locate all the computer work stations
choices.C: utilization of Location Services or voice applications

discussion.content: I guess ABE is correct, as virtual IP is mandatory while doing mobility
